p: Phenols and monoterpene hydrocarbons predominated in the samples of thyme and Greek oregano, while marjoram etheric oil was high in oxygenated monoterpenes and monoterpene hydrocarbons. These groups of compounds demonstrated the highest activity against the tested P. zopfii strains: Sesquiterpenes, hydrocarbons, sulfur and carbonilic compounds do not seem to be as effective in inhibiting the activity of P. zopfii isolates.
